title: The US OPEN: Notes & Numbers
body_text:
"One of the top 200 events I've ever attended," said a sarcastic Edwards during the patriotic gathering.
But don't let the comedic line fool you - "The Crazy One" was one of many legendary figures who praised the Adams-only main event as well as the overall joust between lifelong friends on this July 4th weekend. If you unfortunately missed the competitive fireworks (or simply couldn't get your hands on a Katz-purchased YooHoo or Gatorade), indulge in these leftover notes and numbers from the 2016 US OPEN.
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
In an ultra-rare, [possibly] first-time occurrence, captains Tom and Kevin were the first two combatants eliminated! The younger Kevin connected with a perfectly timed opening rush shot on his brother within the first 10 seconds of Game 1. Less than 2 minutes later, Grant Cornero extracted revenge by nailing his former rival with a bulletball to the back.
body_html:
"One of the top 200 events I've ever attended," said a sarcastic Edwards during the patriotic gathering.

But don't let the comedic line fool you - "The Crazy One" was one of many legendary figures who praised the Adams-only main event as well as the overall joust between lifelong friends on this July 4th weekend. If you unfortunately missed the competitive fireworks (or simply couldn't get your hands on a Katz-purchased YooHoo or Gatorade), indulge in these leftover notes and numbers from the 2016 US OPEN.



ONLINE EXCLUSIVE! In an ultra-rare, [possibly] first-time occurrence, captains Tom and Kevin were the first two combatants eliminated! The younger Kevin connected with a perfectly timed opening rush shot on his brother within the first 10 seconds of Game 1. Less than 2 minutes later, Grant Cornero extracted revenge by nailing his former rival with a bulletball to the back.
